intro: Clidemia retropila, commonly known as the silverleaf wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and stream banks. Its leaves are covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Clidemia retropila is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
